ground_truth: Gin munches on his orange and regards bespectacled Bob, who looks away thoughtfully. That night, Willie drives a seven series BMW in through the gates of the motel, sees someone with a torch in his room, and kills the lights of the car. She takes the strawberry blonde wig off and comes over. On the phone, Willie puts his stuff down on a bed and begins taking off his fake snow-covered boots. He gets off the bed, goes over to a wardrobe, and the kid watches Willie in the bath, blinking a couple of times. Willie lies in bed with the kid hovering at the bedside, and the next morning, Willie is still asleep in bed when the kid comes in, clutching a glass of orange juice and an advent calendar. Gradually, Willie surfaces from his slumber, sits up, and takes the glass, gives the kid a look, and puts the glass down. The kid climbs onto the bed, settles beside Willie, opens the relevant door on the calendar, and then reads what's written on the back of the door. The kid gives a doubtful-looking Willie the door, knocks the chocolate out of the calendar, performs the action, and turns to Willie. The kid gets off the bed, and Willie looks dubiously at the door off the calendar. At lunchtime, he is eating with Marcus and his oriental girlfriend, Lois, at a restaurant in the mall. Marcus regards him with thinly-veiled contempt as Willie masticates a massive mouthful of salad and glares vainfully at Marcus. Lois and Marcus head off, and a mom and her young son spot Willie in his Santa suit. Jimmy's mother looks at Willie expectantly as she holds the hand of her sulky boy by her side. Jimmy's mum scoops him up and hurries away, leaving dear old Santa to his salad. Out in the shops, Lois scrutinizes a swatch of fabric, tries on a pair of designer sunglasses, moves on, and looks over a mink stole with a very critical eye. Having decided it's not too bad, she notes it down on her shopping list, and detecting a possible sale, a saleswoman comes over to her. Again, Gin, the security chief, walks up behind a boy pursuing a shelf of video games and then turns back to the boy. Back at his new digs, Willie is playing checkers with the kid who moves a piece, keeping his finger on it, uncertain, he moves it back again. Willie eyes the kid a little impatiently as the kid moves another counter, still keeps a pudgy finger on it, looks at Willie, changes his mind, and moves it back. Willie watches as the kid moves a third piece but still keeps his finger on the counter.

That evening, Willie pilots a seven series BMW in through the entrances of the inn, notices somebody with a flashlight in his chamber, and extinguishes the beams of the automobile. test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Gin, leisurely enjoying his orange, observes Bob, who is wearing glasses. Bob, rather than meeting Gin's gaze, looks thoughtfully into the distance. Later that same evening, Willie makes his way in a sleek, seven series BMW, driving it smoothly through the gates of a motel. As he approaches his room, he notices a faint light showing that someone is inside, using a torch, and he promptly switches off the car's headlights. Removing her strawberry blonde wig, she approaches Willie with purpose. Once inside, Willie is on the phone as he casually places his belongings on the bed, methodically removing his snow-dusted fake boots. Rising from the bed, he heads towards the wardrobe, and meanwhile, a young onlooker observes Willie bathing, blinking a couple of times in curiosity. Settling in for the night, Willie lies in bed while the kid hovers nearby, attentively standing at the bedside. The following morning, Willie is still deeply asleep when the kid enters the room, holding both a glass of orange juice and an advent calendar. Gradually, as consciousness returns, Willie shifts from his slumber, sits up, accepts the glass from the kid, looks at him with a mix of acknowledgment and inquiry, and places the glass on the side. The kid clambers onto the bed, snuggles beside Willie, opens the appropriate door of the advent calendar, and reads aloud the message inscribed on the back of the door. With a look of doubt, the kid hands the door to Willie, knocks the chocolate treat out of the calendar, performs the suggested action, and turns his attention back to Willie. The kid dismounts from the bed, while Willie gives the calendar door a wary glance. Later, around lunchtime, Willie finds himself dining alongside Marcus and Marcus's oriental girlfriend, Lois, at a bustling restaurant situated in the mall. Marcus, with an expression of thinly-veiled contempt, watches Willie as he takes an enormous bite of salad, glaring in vain hope for approval. After their meal, Lois and Marcus leave together, and suddenly, a mother with her young son catches sight of Willie, who is dressed in his Santa suit. Jimmy's mother, holding onto her sulky boy's hand, looks at Willie with expectation. Quickly, she picks up Jimmy and hurries away, leaving dear old Santa, alone, to enjoy his salad. Meanwhile, in the bustling shops, Lois carefully examines a swatch of fabric, tries on a pair of chic designer sunglasses, and moves on to inspect a mink stole with a keenly critical approach. Deciding it seems satisfactory, she jots it down on her shopping list, capturing the interest of a nearby saleswoman who senses a potential sale and approaches Lois. Elsewhere, Gin, the dedicated security chief, quietly approaches behind a boy who is absorbed in examining a shelf stocked with video games. Gin then turns his attention back to the boy. Returning to his newly acquired place, Willie engages in a game of checkers with the kid. The kid, unsure, moves a piece, keeping his finger resting on it indecisively, and eventually shifts it back. Willie observes with a touch of impatience as the kid moves another piece, continuing to hold a chubby finger on it, glancing at Willie for input, reconsiders, and moves it back. Willie continues to watch as the kid moves a third piece, yet still keeps his finger on the counter, wavering in his decision.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Gin slowly munches on his orange, savoring each bite as he sits and observes bespectacled Bob, who turns his head away thoughtfully, lost in his own world. Later that night, Willie expertly maneuvers a seven-series BMW through the gates of the motel, his eyes scanning the surroundings until he spots the faint light of a torch flickering in his room. He immediately reacts by switching off the car's lights to avoid drawing attention. With stealth, he removes the strawberry blonde wig perched on his head, runs a hand through his hair, and proceeds to approach the room. Inside, on the phone, Willie places his belongings gently on the bed's surface before methodically unlacing and sliding off his fake snow-covered boots, one by one. He then shifts off the bed, executes a smooth pivot toward the wardrobe, and across the room, the kid watches Willie intently from the bathroom, blinking a couple of times as if processing the scene. Willie eventually stretches out in bed, lying down as the kid hovers nearby at the bedside. When the next morning arrives, Willie remains deeply asleep, undisturbed, until the kid enters the room, holding a glass of orange juice in one hand and clutching an advent calendar in the other. Willie gradually emerges from his slumber, each movement slow and deliberate, until he finally sits up. He accepts the glass from the kid, examining him with a look of mild curiosity, then places the glass on a nearby surface. The kid climbs onto the bed with a small bounce, nestles beside Willie, and proceeds to open the relevant door on the advent calendar, enthusiastically reading the inscription on the back of the door aloud. With a mixture of skepticism and interest, Willie observes as the kid hands him the calendar door, deftly knocks the chocolate free from the cavity, and performs the action described on it, before turning back to Willie, eager for his reaction. The kid then slides off the bed, leaving Willie holding the door of the calendar, which he inspects dubiously. Around lunchtime, Willie finds himself seated at a restaurant in the mall, partaking in a meal with Marcus and his oriental girlfriend, Lois. As Willie stuffs his mouth with a large serving of salad, chewing methodically, Marcus observes him with barely disguised disdain. Willie, feeling the tension, locks eyes with Marcus and glares, attempting to assert himself. Eventually, Lois and Marcus rise from the table, leaving Willie to his salad. Meanwhile, a mother and her young son notice Willie, still clad in his Santa suit. Jimmy's mother looks at Willie expectantly, holding the hand of her sulky child, but quickly decides to scoop him up and briskly walk away, leaving the solitary Santa to continue his meal. Elsewhere in the shops, Lois meticulously inspects a swatch of fabric, then slides on a pair of designer sunglasses, evaluating her reflection before moving on to examine a mink stole, assessing it with a discerning eye. Deciding that the stole is satisfactory, she records it on her shopping list. Noticing her interest, a saleswoman approaches, hoping to secure a sale. Once again, Gin, the security chief, subtly approaches from behind a boy who is engrossed in browsing a shelf of video games. Gin observes, then redirects his attention back to the boy. Back at his new accommodations, Willie engages in a game of checkers with the kid who places a piece tentatively on the board, hesitating with a finger still on it before retracting the move. Willie watches with a hint of impatience as the kid proceeds to tactically move another counter, yet keeps his pudgy finger on it, glances at Willie for reassurance, and again changes his mind, moving it back. Willie continues to observe as the kid, exhibiting the same uncertainty, places a third piece on the board but maintains a finger on it, clearly deliberating.

In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. Lois and Marcus head off and a mom and her young son spot Willie in his Santa suit. Jimmy's mother looks at Willie expectantly as she holds the hand of her sulky boy by her side. Jimmy's mum scoops him up and hurries away leaving dear old Santa to his salad. Out in the shops Lois scrutinizes a swatch of fabric tries on a pair of designer sunglasses moves on and looks over a mink stole with a very critical eye. Having decided it is not too bad she notes it down on her shopping list and detecting a possible sale. a saleswoman comes over to her. Again Gin. the security chief walks up behind a boy pursuing a shelf of video games and then turns back to the boy. Back at his new digs. Willie is playing checkers with the kid who moves a piece keeping his finger on it. uncertain he moves it back again. Willie eyes the kid a little impatiently as the kid moves another counter still keeps a pudgy finger on it looks at. Willie changes his mind and moves it back. Willie watches as the kid moves a third piece but still keeps his finger on the counter.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Max devours his apple and observes scruffy Tim, who glances upwards dreamily. That morning, Lucy pedals a shiny red bicycle through the doors of the library, spots someone with a lantern in her section, and dims the lantern. He removes the red cap and ambles over. On the tablet, Lucy places her bag down on a couch and begins peeling off her muddy soccer cleats. She stands from the couch, heads over to a desk, and the toddler watches Lucy in the garden, yawning a couple of times. Lucy stretches out on the couch with the toddler crouching nearby, and the next evening, Lucy is still dozing on the couch when the toddler enters, clasping a mug of apple cider and a puzzle box. Slowly, Lucy emerges from her nap, rises, and receives the mug, gives the toddler a glance, and sets the mug aside. The toddler climbs onto the couch, nestles beside Lucy, slides open the correct drawer on the puzzle, and then reads what's scribbled on the inside of the drawer. The toddler hands a skeptical-looking Lucy the drawer, jostles the candy out of the puzzle, enacts the motion, and faces Lucy. The toddler clambers off the couch, and Lucy stares hesitantly at the drawer from the puzzle. At dinner, she is chatting with Peter and his European companion, Alice, at a diner in the park. Peter watches her with barely disguised irritation as Lucy devours a huge spoonful of soup and frowns disapprovingly at Peter. Alice and Peter depart, and a grandma and her curious granddaughter notice Lucy in her wizard costume. Bella's grandma gazes at Lucy hopefully as she grips the hand of her pouting girl beside her. Bella’s grandma scoops her granddaughter up and scurries off, leaving the quirky old wizard to her soup. Around the boutiques, Alice inspects a roll of wallpaper, tries on a set of stylish earrings, proceeds onward, and examines a silk scarf with an extremely discerning gaze. Deciding it's fairly decent, she jots it down on her wish list, and sensing a potential customer, a shopkeeper approaches her. Once more, Max, the janitorial supervisor, strides up behind a girl inspecting a rack of comic books and then turns toward the girl. Back at her old loft, Lucy is playing chess with the toddler who shifts a knight, maintaining her grip on it, indecisively, she moves it back again. Lucy gazes at the toddler somewhat impatiently as the toddler relocates another pawn, still keeps her tiny grip on it, observes Lucy, changes her decision, and retreats her move. Lucy watches as the toddler moves a third rook but continues to keep her grip on the pawn.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Gin eats an orange while observing Bob, who looks away. Later, Willie drives a BMW into a motel, noticing someone in his room, so he turns off the car lights. Willie, wearing a strawberry blonde wig, enters, removes his snow-covered boots, and lies in bed. The next morning, a kid brings him orange juice and an advent calendar. Willie takes the juice, watches the kid open the calendar door, reads what’s inside, and doubts its meaning. Later, Willie eats with Marcus and his girlfriend Lois, who leave as a mom and her son see Willie in a Santa suit. In the mall, Lois shops critically, while Gin monitors a boy near video games. Back at the motel, Willie plays checkers with the kid, who hesitates with his moves, testing Willie's patience.
